creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: garden with still pond; figure in maroon standing on a walkway with a small bridge over pond; two seated figures wearing blue kimonos with white dots in foreground, LLQ; green, grey and tan earth tones
inscription: left: 自刻  昭和十六年作  お庭 {Jikoku, Shōwa jūrokunen saku, [?????]} | bottom, in grey: Linnoji Garden | in pencil: Toshi Yoshida
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Linnoji Garden
